text.0:
A claim that Uganda's president has ordered mobile money platforms to close in order to block opposition legislator Robert Kyagulanyi's funding is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:mobile_phone: Operators blamed recent outages on technical issues, and the government has denied the claim: https://t.co/qhqTTCc1di
text.1:
A claim that German intelligence has confirmed the arrest of Uganda’s Minister for Security, General Elly Tumwine, over the death of a German national is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The news has not been reported elsewhere, and General Tumwine has dismissed the claim: https://t.co/52IcFMlmxr
text.2:
An image of @TheStarKenya’s front page with a headline claiming that the life of the chairman of Kenya’s electoral body is in danger is ALTERED.

:newspaper: The newspaper published a different lead story on the date shown in the image: https://t.co/oTh4eGvXu9
text.3:
A Facebook post claiming that socialite Bryan Kirumira, popularly known as Bryan White, is giving away money to businesses is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:money_with_wings: Mr Kirumira's spokesperson dismissed the claim as fake and said he does not know of such a giveaway: https://t.co/HoANiiyn1p
text.4:
:police_car_light: HOAX: A Facebook account claiming that a journalist from Kenya's Citizen TV is recruiting people for money-making opportunities is fake.

:warning_selector: Rashid Abdalla has disowned the Facebook account and says he is not involved in the scheme: https://t.co/OynaewuTfN
text.5:
An article claiming that Rwanda’s president, Paul Kagame, has appointed 19-year-old Patrick Nkurunzinza as Minister of Technology and Development is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: An announcement has not been made about the current minister, Paula Ingabire, being replaced: https://t.co/J5S7Dtr2KD
text.6:
A Facebook post using a photo to claim that members of the Ethiopian National Defense Force serving under current Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed brutally assaulted a police officer is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The photo first appeared online in July 2016: https://t.co/yBAF4YMLtN
